(OOC: I will be going out of town for two weeks starting 8/11/00. In the 
meantime Iron Raptor said she�d RP Tav for me, and if Yanshosh needs 
Hysteria for anything he can RP her^_^ I guess I�ll see you guys in two 
weeks! Oh, dcoburn, I�m not gonna acknowledge you in my post cause I won�t 
be able to finish anything I start^_^ I�ll leave that to Carnage and IR)

Tavatron watched quietly as Dinobot continued to groom himself. The various 
shards of broken armor being tossed aside without a second thought. She 
backed up a bit, doing her best to avoid the mech stained ground. She hated 
the smell of the silver robotic fluid, not to mention the taste. Half the 
time she wouldn�t even lick her own wounds. Tavatron sighed as she gazed 
skyward, watching the sun as it began it�s descent below the horizon. The 
sound of the babbling brook sending a slight shiver of relaxation through 
her body. Forget the base, she could spend the rest of her life right here.

Finally Tavatron opened her eyes. Her gaze was met by a small puddle of 
fluid that had begun to form around her knees and lower legs. She hadn�t 
realized Dinobot was bleeding this badly. He needed medical attention, and 
soon. Tavatron transformed to beast mode, perhaps she would be able to get 
some hunting done before they set out again. Food would help restore some of 
their lost strength. Tavatron, now on all fours, raised her snout towards 
the darkening sky and let loose one long, endless howl. She was asking the 
wolves of the surrounding area if there was any large game nearby. A reply 
of several howls immediately sounded from deep within the surrounding trees. 
Tavatron sighed, there was nothing to hunt but small rabbits and a few 
larger birds. She just didn�t have the energy for a rabbit hunt.

Tavarton sat back on her haunches, her eyes eagerly searching the 
surrounding trees for any signs of life. She hadn�t realized just how hungry 
she was. A small snarl escaped her lips as she dropped to the ground. Her 
joints were still sore, but she was more or less repaired. Her internal 
systems had done a thorough job of repairing her. She lifted an eye ridge as 
she looked at Dinobot from the corner of her optic. For a second he seemed 
to be looking at her as well, but quickly averted his gaze. Perhaps he 
didn�t want her to see what she already knew. He had to be concerned about 
his welfare. Any �bot with the amount of damage he had sustained would be.

Tavatron growled softly, wondering why he wasn�t at least licking his 
wounds. Any predator worth their hunting prowess would know that the best 
way to stop the flow of blood was to lick the wound clean. She continued to 
look Dinobot over. He was in pretty bad shape. His TM2 armor was quite 
damaged, not to mention the various pieces of shrapnel that were most likely 
still caught in his chest. The smallest pieces were the hardest to remove. 
Tavatron�s ears perked as it dawned on her, he was a TM2! Why hadn�t she 
thought of it before? He didn�t have the organic compound necessary to clot 
his blood. He probably had to let his wounds bleed out. That could be a 
costly decision, but one he most likely had to accept:

"I am not going to let you bleed to death. There must be something I can 
do?"

Tavatron continued to lay a few feet from him, her paws stretched even 
further before her. She loved stretching in beast mode, feeling each muscle, 
each tendon, pulling beneath her organic skin. Tavatron sighed softly as she 
continued to watch Dinobot, concern written on her face. She already knew 
what she could do, but not necessarily what she wanted to do. Just the 
thought of tasting mech-fluid made her grimace. Tavatron sighed as she 
stood, took a deep breath, and walked toward Dinobot:

"Try to hold still, alright? I don�t want to do this anymore than you want 
me too, but I am not going to let you bleed to death."

Tavatron placed a firm paw on his back as she leaned her head down toward 
his injured side. She quickly began licking away the excess fluid, doing her 
best to clean the wound before the taste of fluid sent her into convulsions. 
Tavatron finished in a matter of moments, but the taste still lingered. 
Tavatron turned away from Dinobot as she lowered her head toward the ground, 
spitting out the silver fluid that coated her tongue. She ran toward the 
edge of the brook, dipping her snout in the cool water as she swallowed 
mouthfuls of water. Finally she just laid down beside the stream, she didn�t 
regret what she�d done, she just really didn�t like the taste of fluid. She 
never had and she never will.
